column1: Considering the above, it is clear that the plea of non est factum is extremely narrow in
its application. With the Plaintiff neither being blind nor illiterate, in order to succeed with
the plea, he was required to satisfy the following:

column2: That  he  was  under  a  fundamental  misapprehension  as  to  the  nature  of  the
document that was signed with such document being radically different from the
one the Plaintiff intended to sign, as a result of being misled or induced by deception
The Plaintiff must not have been negligent.
